trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values.

Members of this class behave exactly as described by the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>, <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601>, and <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> documentation, except that this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert `null` into the collection.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.

For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*oneOrMoreKInt32Values*
One or more <xref:System.Int32> values, with each pair delimited by a single comma and/or one or more spaces:
<xref:System.Int32> *[delimeter* <xref:System.Int32> *]\**
For example, `"5 10 43"` and `"5,10,43"` are both valid.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> class with the specified collection of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values.
The collection of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values that make up the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> class with the specified capacity, or the number of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values the collection is initially capable of storing.
The number of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values that the collection is initially capable of storing.
Adds an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to the end of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to add to the end of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes all <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values from the collection.
This method does not change the capacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Copies all of the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values in a collection to a specified array.
Identifies the array to which content is copied.
Index position in the array to which the contents of the collection are copied.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of items in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
The number of <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> values contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
Returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection.Enumerator"></xref> that can iterate through the collection.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection.Enumerator"></xref> that can iterate through the collection.
Searches for the specified <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
The <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> into a specific location within the collection.
The index position at which the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to insert in the collection.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> at the specified index position.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> at the specified index.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the .
Returns an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> created from a specified string.
The string that is converted to an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
An instance of created from source.
Removes an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> from the collection.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to remove from the collection.
`true` if value was removed from the ; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> at the specified index position from the collection.
Index position of the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> to be removed.
Converts the current value of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> to a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
Converts the current value of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> to a <xref href="System.String"></xref> using the specified culture-specific formatting information.
Culture-specific formatting information.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which to insert the <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Int32Collection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.IFormattable> interface.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
